metadata.title: CVE-2022-4744 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A double-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s TUN/TAP device driverfunctionality in how a user registers the device when theregister_netdevice function fails (NETDEV_REGISTER notifier). This flawallows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges onthe system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
